parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name>game1</name>=<value> arma1

</value></part><part><name>version1</name>=<value> 1.00

</value></part><part><name>game2</name>=<value> arma2

</value></part><part><name>version2</name>=<value> 1.00

</value></part><part><name>game3</name>=<value> arma2oa

</value></part><part><name>version3</name>=<value> 1.51

</value></part><part><name>game4</name>=<value> tkoh

</value></part><part><name>version4</name>=<value> 1.00

</value></part><part><name>game5</name>=<value> arma3

</value></part><part><name>version5</name>=<value> 0.50

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation

</value></part><part><name>gr2</name>=<value> Render Time Scope

</value></part><part><name>descr</name>=<value> Returns position in model space and returns its relative position. Searches first in memory level, then in geometry [[LOD]]s.<br>
In <template><title>arma</title></template> it returns the initial position of the selection, in <template><title>arma2</title></template>/<template><title>arma3</title></template> position of the selection (e.g. when it is animated) in render time scope. If a selection does not exist [0,0,0] is returned.

</value></part><part><name>s1</name>=<value> object '''selectionPosition''' selectionName

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> object: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> selectionName: [[String]]

</value></part><part><name>r1</name>=<value> [[Array]] - relative position in model space. If selection does not exist, <template><title>ic</title><part><name index="1"/><value>[0, 0, 0]</value></part></template> is returned.

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> object '''selectionPosition''' [selectionName, LODName] <template><title>Since</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.49.131660</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value>y</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> object: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> [selectionName, LODName]: [[Array]]

</value></part><part><name>p23</name>=<value> selectionName: [[String]]

</value></part><part><name>p24</name>=<value> LODName: [[String]] - LOD name, one of the following:
* "Memory"
* "Geometry"
* "FireGeometry"
* "LandContact"
* "HitPoints"

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Array]] - relative position in model space. If selection does not exist, <template><title>ic</title><part><name index="1"/><value>[0, 0, 0]</value></part></template> is returned.

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_inModelPosition = [[player]] [[selectionPosition]] "head_hit";</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_inModelPosition = [[player]] [[selectionPosition]] "pelvis";</code>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> <code>_inModelPosition = [[player]] [[selectionPosition]] "head";</code>

</value></part><part><name>x4</name>=<value> <code>_inModelPosition = [[player]] [[selectionPosition]] "camera";</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[modelToWorld]] [[selectionNames]] [[getAllHitPointsDamage]]
</value></part></template>


<dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on June 25, 2017 - 15:13 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone Kid|Killzone Kid]]</dt>
<dd class="note">Do use the filter that comes with Alt Syntax to suit your needs. For example [[player]] has 3 selections called "head" and their [[selectionPosition]]s are quite different from each other:
<code>[[player]] [[selectionPosition]] ["head", "Memory"]; // [0.173798,0.330415,1.37783]
[[player]] [[selectionPosition]] ["head", "FireGeometry"]; // [0.14375,0.206039,1.44689]
[[player]] [[selectionPosition]] ["head", "HitPoints"]; // [0.144257,0.306769,1.53471]</code></dd>
</dl></root>
